P.title: Will Canada hold a national referendum on energy independence before January 1, 2028?

P.title: Will a new chemical compound developed by a publicly traded company receive a patent before January 1, 2028?
P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a new chemical compound developed by a publicly traded company receives a patent between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The patent must be officially granted and listed in the patent office records of a major jurisdiction such as the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) or the European Patent Office (EPO).

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) Tesla announces and releases a fully autonomous vehicle for public purchase and (b) no new chemical compound developed by a publicly traded company receives a patent?
Q_and_not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, both of the following conditions are met: (a) Tesla announces and releases a fully autonomous vehicle (Level 5 autonomy) for public purchase. The vehicle must be available for sale to the general public and meet the criteria for Level 5 autonomy as defined by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE). (b) No new chemical compound developed by a publicly traded company receives a patent. The patent must not be officially granted and listed in the patent office records of a major jurisdiction such as the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) or the European Patent Office (EPO).

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur before January 1, 2028: (a) a new chemical compound developed by a publicly traded company receives a patent, or (b) Tesla announces and releases a fully autonomous vehicle for public purchase?
P_or_Q.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if either of the following occurs between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) A new chemical compound developed by a publicly traded company receives a patent. The patent must be officially granted and listed in the patent office records of a major jurisdiction such as the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) or the European Patent Office (EPO). (b) Tesla announces and releases a fully autonomous vehicle (Level 5 autonomy) for public purchase. The vehicle must be available for sale to the general public and meet the criteria for Level 5 autonomy as defined by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE).

P.title: Will a new chemical compound developed by a publicly traded company receive a patent before January 1, 2028?
P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if a new chemical compound developed by a publicly traded company receives a patent between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The patent must be officially granted and listed in the patent office records of a major jurisdiction such as the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) or the European Patent Office (EPO).

Q.title: Will Tesla announce and release a fully autonomous vehicle for public purchase before January 1, 2028?
Q.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024 and January 1, 2028, Tesla announces and releases a fully autonomous vehicle (Level 5 autonomy) for public purchase. The vehicle must be available for sale to the general public and meet the criteria for Level 5 autonomy as defined by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE).

reasons: Both questions relate to developments in technology and innovation, which could be influenced by the same market dynamics and investor sentiments.
The success of a new chemical compound could impact Tesla's operations, especially if it relates to battery technology or materials used in vehicle production.
The timeline for both events falls within the same period, making it relevant to consider how advancements in one area may affect the other.
relevance.conclusion: It makes sense to consider the logical combination of these questions as they both pertain to significant technological advancements that could influence each other.
